page.title: 01NORTH SEA CAMP
page.content: Over 50 years ago boys from a centre near Stafford marched to Freiston Shore in order to build a Borstal Camp so that they could be usefully employed and reclaim land from the Wash. This work is still going on and has so far reclaimed about 950 acres of land.The bank is made of clay and silt and is built up using either hand labour,the boys from the Detention Centre, or machinery, diggers, drag-lines and a minature railway. The railway goes out into the Wash where there is a digger.The digger scoops mud out and puts it into the bogeys.They travel back,take the bogeys up to the top of the bank,travel half way along the bank and are then tipped over the opposite side of the bank.The bank has to be high enough to keep out the tide which can be as high as 8.5 meters.
